Sentencas: A time-accurate transient model of an anode-supported solid-oxide-fuel-cell (SOFC) membrane-electrode assembly (MEA) is developed and used as the basis for simulating electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS).
Titulo: Modeling electrochemical impedance spectra in SOFC button cells with internal methane reforming

Sentencas: The one-dimensional model includes porous-media transport, elementary heterogeneous chemical reaction, ion conduction, and electrochemical charge transfer.
Titulo: Modeling electrochemical impedance spectra in SOFC button cells with internal methane reforming

Sentencas: Porous-media transport is represented by the dusty-gas model and electrochemical charge-transfer is modeled with a modified Butler-Volmer formulation.
Titulo: Modeling electrochemical impedance spectra in SOFC button cells with internal methane reforming

Sentencas: A button-cell configuration is used, with the fuel and air flows modeled as perfectly stirred reactors.
Titulo: Modeling electrochemical impedance spectra in SOFC button cells with internal methane reforming

Sentencas: Impedance spectra are determined by imposing oscillating electric currents over a range of frequencies and observing the resulting cell voltage.
Titulo: Modeling electrochemical impedance spectra in SOFC button cells with internal methane reforming

Sentencas: Results are discussed for hydrogen and methane fuels, including the effects of internal methane reforming chemistry.
Titulo: Modeling electrochemical impedance spectra in SOFC button cells with internal methane reforming
